subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The resistance of a building or structure must be greater than the most critical action effect resulting from different combinations of actions, where—

ol.li: the most critical action effect on a building or structure must be determined in accordance with 2.2.3 and the general design procedures contained in AS/NZS 1170.0; and
the resistance of a building or structure is determined in accordance with 2.2.4.

callout.p: A building or structure must be designed to resist the most critical effect resulting from different combinations of actions, taking into consideration—

ul.li: the probability of simultaneous occurrence of two or more actions; and
the levels of reliability of the structure when subject to combined actions; and

callout.p: Determining the levels of reliability of the structure when subject to combined actions should be consistent with the levels of reliability implicit in the design events for natural phenomenon. When designing for the maximum combined actions, a principle frequently adopted is that the maximum is likely to occur when at least one of the actions is at its maximum value.
